main event: Multiple unidentified objects were visually observed and tracked on ground-radar over Dayton, Ohio on July 7 and 10, 1962.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright, round, white and yellow lights that moved erratically, accelerating rapidly, descending, and disappearing.
The objects' flight paths were irregular and random, and their speed and behavior were considered abnormal for aircraft.
Similar objects were reported by multiple witnesses in the same area during this time period.

The objects were initially thought to possibly be balloons or astronomical phenomena, but were ultimately categorized as 'probably aircraft' or 'probably astronomical' due to insufficient data for a definitive evaluation.
The witnesses included a retired Air Force colonel who had previously observed similar unidentified objects in the Dayton area in 1957.
sighted object: bright, round, white and yellow lights moving erratically
witnesses: multiple, including a retired Air Force colonel
